title: Unit 5 Checkpoint: Polygons & Quadrilaterals
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of polygon angle sums, the quadrilateral hierarchy (parallelogram, rectangle, rhombus, square), quadrilateral proofs, and trapezoid/kite properties.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: (n-2)×180° for interior sum, 360°/n for each exterior angle, working backwards from given angle
Parallelogram: opp sides/angles congruent, consec angles supplementary, diags bisect. Rectangle: diags congruent. Rhombus: diags perpendicular, bisect angles
Using SAS/ASA + CPCTC with shared diagonals, inherited properties in hierarchy
Midsegment = (b₁+b₂)/2, isosceles base angles congruent, kite diags perpendicular, area=(d₁×d₂)/2

assessmentProblems.question: The interior angles of a polygon sum to 1260°. How many sides does it have?
Each interior angle of a regular polygon measures 160°. Find the number of sides and the sum of all interior angles.
In parallelogram JKLM, ∠J = (4x + 5)° and ∠K = (6x - 25)°. Find x and all four angles.
In rectangle ABCD, diagonals intersect at E. If AE = 2x + 3 and CE = 4x - 7, find x, AE, and the full diagonal AC.
assessmentProblems.answer: Diagonals bisect each other: AE = CE → 2x+3=4x-7 → 10=2x → x=5. AE=CE=13. AC=26.

assessmentProblems.question: Rhombus WXYZ has diagonals WY = 40 and XZ = 30. Find the length of each side.
assessmentProblems.answer: Half-diagonals: 20 and 15. Side = √(20²+15²) = √(400+225) = √625 = 25. (This is 5× the 3-4-5 triple.)

assessmentProblems.question: True or false with justification: (a) Every square is a parallelogram. (b) Every rhombus is a rectangle. (c) If a parallelogram has one right angle, it must be a rectangle.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) True — a square has both pairs of opposite sides parallel. (b) False — a rhombus doesn't need right angles (only a rhombus with right angles is a rectangle, i.e. a square). (c) True — if one angle is 90°, consecutive supplementary makes the next 90°, and opposite angles are also 90°.

assessmentProblems.question: A trapezoid has bases (3x + 2) and (5x - 6). The midsegment is 22. Find x and both base lengths.
In isosceles trapezoid ABCD with AB ∥ DC, ∠A = (5x + 5)° and ∠D = (3x + 15)°. Find x and all four angles.
Write a proof: Given ABCD is a rectangle with diagonals AC and BD. Prove AC ≅ BD.
assessmentProblems.answer: 1. ABCD is a rectangle (Given). 2. ∠DAB = ∠CBA = 90° (Def of rectangle). 3. AB ≅ AB (Reflexive). 4. AD ≅ BC (Opp sides of parallelogram congruent). 5. △DAB ≅ △CBA (SAS: steps 4, 2, 3). 6. AC ≅ BD (CPCTC).

assessmentProblems.question: ANALYSIS: In parallelogram ABCD, AB = 3x - 1, BC = 2y + 3, CD = x + 7, DA = y + 8. Also, ∠A = (5z + 10)° and ∠B = (7z - 10)°. Find x, y, z, all side lengths, all angles, and the perimeter.
assessmentProblems.answer: Opposite sides congruent: AB=CD → 3x-1=x+7 → 2x=8 → x=4. AB=CD=11. BC=DA → 2y+3=y+8 → y=5. BC=DA=13. Perimeter=2(11+13)=48. Consecutive supplementary: (5z+10)+(7z-10)=180 → 12z=180 → z=15. ∠A=∠C=85°, ∠B=∠D=95°. Check: 85+95+85+95=360° ✓.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Special Right Triangles): In a 30-60-90 triangle, the hypotenuse is 16. Find the short leg and the long leg.
SPIRAL (CPCTC): △PQR ≅ △STU. If PQ = 11, QR = 15, and ∠Q = 72°, find ST, TU, and ∠T.
spiralReview.answer: P↔S, Q↔T, R↔U. ST = PQ = 11, TU = QR = 15, ∠T = ∠Q = 72°.
